quiz.title: Unit 1: Foundations & Measurement (Quiz 7)
quiz.subtitle: SI Units, Instruments, and Error Calculation (10 Questions)
quiz.subject: Physics

questions.question: The SI unit of length is:
questions.explanation: The meter (m) is the SI base unit for length. Centimeter and kilometer are derived from it, and inch is non-SI.

questions.question: The SI unit of mass is:
questions.explanation: The kilogram (kg) is the SI base unit for mass, even though gram is more common in everyday use.

questions.question: The SI unit of time is:
questions.explanation: The second (s) is the SI base unit for time. Minute, hour, and day are non-SI units.

questions.question: Which of the following is a derived unit?
questions.explanation: Newton (N) is a derived unit: 1 N = 1 kg·m/s². Meter, second, and kilogram are base units.

questions.question: A vernier caliper can measure lengths accurately up to:
questions.explanation: The least count of a typical vernier caliper is 0.01 cm (0.1 mm). 0.01 cm = 0.1 mm.

questions.question: The least count of a screw gauge is usually of the order of:
questions.explanation: A typical screw gauge (micrometer) has a least count of 0.01 mm or 0.001 cm.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a fundamental quantity in physics?
questions.explanation: Force is a derived quantity (mass × acceleration). Mass, length, and time are fundamental quantities.

questions.question: Which instrument measures very small length or displacements with high precision?
questions.explanation: Micrometer screw gauge measures small lengths (like wire diameter) with precision up to 0.01 mm.
